intro: Hormidium, commonly known as the ghost plant, is a unique member of the family Pityophyllaceae. It is a small, evergreen shrub that typically grows in shaded, moist environments. Hormidium has a distinctive appearance, with its leaves arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. It is also notable for its ability to survive in harsh conditions, making it an interesting subject for botanical study.
